org.bk.ass.bt

Class TreeNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bk.ass.bt.TreeNode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AcquireLock, BehaviorTree, CompoundNode, Condition, Decorator, Distributor, LambdaNode, Wait

    public abstract class TreeNode
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class of all of ASS' behavior trees.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreeNode

        public TreeNode()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Should be called before using this node.

      • close

        public void close()
        Should be called if this node will not be used again and might perform some operations at the end. If used for clean-ups, be aware that some nodes might get abort()ed instead and will not receive a close call.

      • exec

        public void exec(ExecutionContext executionContext)
        Executes this node, with an ExecutionContext for meta data.

      • exec

        public abstract void exec()
        Executes this node without any meta data context.

      • getUtility

        public double getUtility()
        Used by CompoundNodes to determine order of execution. Generally, nodes with Selector like behavior will run children in decreasing order of utility. Nodes with Sequence like behavior will not change the order of children unless explicitly stated.
        Returns:
        0 by default.

      • getStatus

        public final NodeStatus getStatus()
        Returns the status of the last execution.

      • success

        public final void success()
        Mark node as successful.

      • running

        public final void running()
        Mark node as running.

      • failed

        public final void failed()
        Mark node as failed.

      • abort

        public void abort()
        Aborts any operation of this node and marks the status as aborted. Subclasses should call 
        super.abort()
        on override.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the node and its status. If overridden, should always call 
        super.reset()
        to ensure status is correct.

      • withName

        public final TreeNode withName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets a name for this node which can be used to identify it in the complete tree.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        The previously set name.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
